references.paper_title: Bounds on treatment effects from studies with imperfect compliance
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of partial identification, providing early results on bounding treatment effects when compliance is imperfect and informing many of the later developments in the paper.
This is another highly influential paper establishing the theoretical foundations of partial identification, providing nonparametric bounds for treatment effects without strong assumptions.

This book is a comprehensive and widely cited work on causal inference, providing the theoretical framework underlying many concepts and methods used in the paper, including causal diagrams and counterfactual reasoning.

references.paper_title: Double/debiased machine learning for treatment and structural parameters
references.reason: This paper introduces double machine learning, a powerful technique used in the paper for efficient and robust estimation of causal effects, especially in high-dimensional settings.

references.paper_title: The analysis of randomized and non-randomized AIDS treatment trials using a new approach to causal inference in longitudinal studies
references.reason: This paper is highly influential in causal inference, introducing important methods for analyzing longitudinal data and causal effects under complex settings which are relevant to the challenges addressed in this paper.
